website_summaries.verdict: Definitely on the expensive side, but you'd be hard pressed to find a more heavy-duty and high-quality tent.
pros: Very roomy, with straight walls for improved headroom
Sets up and breaks down easily
cons: The canvas makes this a very heavy and bulky option
It also mildews and molds very easily if it is not bone dry when you pack it away

customer_reviews.title: Nice built tent.  Not the right tent if your using military size camp cots.
customer_reviews.text: Kodiak tents are very nice. I have a 10x14 Kodiak as well. I bought this one for when its just two camping instead of lugging the 10x14. My regret is I should have bought the 10x10 model because we use camp cots. They are everage size cots and its really tight inside the tent. It would work great if there is just one cot. Point is just an odd size and no room If your using cots.
customer_reviews.author: C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Holy $#@?
customer_reviews.text: This tent is beautiful! Stakes are solid not the flimsy ones you normally get. I was able to set it up all by myself. I took it out for the first time in 20° weather in the snow, rain, and wind. It did everything it said it would. I’m a little paranoid about it getting mold. I tried my best to dry it before packing up and even when I got home I extended it in the backyard a little longer to make sure it dried, before packing it away. Fingers crossed it lasts me years and years! And years!
customer_reviews.author: Orchidsmom

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Haven't had a single problem or leak. I can set it up by myself and holds heat in better then I orginally thought. Not the lightest tent but great in rain and snow
customer_reviews.author: MASTER ROSHI

customer_reviews.title: It's such a great, sturdy tent and is completely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: My parents have the slightly larger version of this tent and I just knew that my husband and I had to get one too. It's such a great, sturdy tent and is completely waterproof. We went camping with some friends and the weather turned rainy one night. We were snug and dry in our canvas tent (and the rain pounding on the top and sides sounded amazing!) while our unfortunate friends in their Coleman and other well-known camping brand tents kept getting water drips. Besides that, the tent really is a breeze to set up, all things considered. While it's easiest with two people, I believe that even one person could set it up, if they needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Julia S.

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Tent, well worth the money spent
customer_reviews.text: After having had our camp destroyed by 55mph winds in Amarillo, I decided to spend the money to purchase this tent. It has not let me down. It has withstood several violent storms and has never leaked a drop. It is spacious enough inside for two queen mattresses and room enough for luggage. While it breathes well and is well ventilated, I wish they would include a portal that could accommodate an A/C for those hot summer days.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Careful when propping it up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May of 2019 and got a few good camping trips out of it both NW rain and sunshine with happy results. Today I took it out to set up in the backyard to properly air it out and clean it. Sadly, when propping it up, the T-bar on one end that holds the lateral support rods broke due to pressure. I still need to reach out to the vendor but just an FYI to other folks that this can happen to you.
customer_reviews.author: meeppdx

customer_reviews.title: The only tent you should ever need
customer_reviews.text: To begin with, this tent is pretty impressive out of the box. I've done some camping this summer with very inexpensive tents, which led me to this purchase. The overall weight and construction let's you know that you got your money's worth. The steel pole frame and the canvas material, not to mention the extremely heavy floor are great. I like the steel stake loops, for longtime wear. Overall, I'm very glad I made the investment. This tent should last me for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.558

customer_reviews.title: Best tent on the market
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. It was recommended to me by several campers/hunters and it was totally worth the money. I’d recommend watching a YouTube to assist with the build. Are more sense than the instructions and they’re a few key points mentioned on the website not mentioned in the instructions—which comes from others’ experiences. It was very spacious. I setup two Coleman queen sized air mattresses during my trial run with my son (pitched it in the back yard) and there was plenty of room. I’m 6’2 220 and found everything comfy as the day is long.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L. Rapier

customer_reviews.title: A super tent. Too heavy for back-packing but great for ...
customer_reviews.text: A super tent. Too heavy for back-packing but great for camping. Very easy to assemble and disassemble. Got caught in a rainstorm first time out and stayed dry. no water in tent. Vents and panels may be opened for cooling. I would recommend a painters drop cloth on top of the flooring. My foldout cot posts could overtime punch holes in the flooring. Stayed warm and dry over week camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: unojo324

customer_reviews.title: Respectable tent for the serious camper. Lives up to it's reputation
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for Burning Man tent camping. Used 12" 5/16 lag bolts with washers to stake. Used Makita 18v to drive them.
customer_reviews.author: JACKIE

customer_reviews.title: Happy camper
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!! I've had my eye on this tent for probably two years. Compared it to just about everything out there and finally decided to pull the trigger, spend the money and go for it! And am I ever a happy camper! This thing is amazing!! Super huge, tons of space, great protection from the elements and excessive amounts of ventilation! Looking forward to years of camping with this tent until we are able to upgrade to a camper trailer.
customer_reviews.author: JGOAT23

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tent
customer_reviews.text: Great quality tent! Love how spacious it is. Got it for burning man and it kept all the dust out. Super easy to set up and break down. The only complaint I have is the fact that the ceiling panel is white and lets in too much light in the morning. I get the part that is serves as the skylight during the day but there should maybe be an option to zip up a darker panel over it to be able to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Lena Mohler

customer_reviews.title: Packed into truck easily. Set up is easier with a little help ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this tent to replace an older nylon tent. Packed into truck easily. Set up is easier with a little help but one person can do it. Spent two nights in rain with our cots touching the side walls. Not one drop through the canvas. One night at Glacier NP we camped next door to a wildlife photographer who also had a Zodiac Canvas (10x10). He loved his tent, too, and he was hard core camper.
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: Really high quality tent!! I have spent many nights in it and absolutely love it. You won’t be packing it in anywhere far but if you’re car camping you’ll be the envy of the place with this beast. Beautiful, comfortable, high quality, well thought out.....the lost goes on. I wanted one for so long and finally pulled the trigger and I’m extremely satisfied with it, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, windproof, water tight, Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Took this out with the family of four. Fits a queen size blow up mattress and a twin with room to spare. Wind was blowing about 20 mph and temp was down to about 26 degrees. No drafts and stayed comfortable. Is easy to set up, no annoying flapping with the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: A lifetime investment
customer_reviews.text: This tent is no joke! Heavy duty and does exactly what it says. I have been camping several times a year for 20+ years now as an adult. We usually buy a new tent annually. I have never seen a tent of this high quality or never even knew tents like this were around. This tent did exactly what it said the first time out. Handled our family of 6 PLUS all our stuff. Everyone had a great night sleep and it felt spacious! I can not recommend this tent enough. If you are looking to make a one-and-done purchase, this is your tent!
customer_reviews.author: The Hunt Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Dry and cozy through nearly 24 hr rainstorm
customer_reviews.text: My Kodiak 4 person tent: Rainstorm? What rainstorm? I'm in love with my tent. Just went through a virtually non-stop thunderstorm from 11:00am Friday Morning through 3:00am Saturday rainstorm with damaging high winds. This tent never wavered, never flooded. I felt safe even when our group was told they could ride out the storm in the cabins, I felt secure that my tent would be just fine. It was more than just fine. I was comfortable in 50 degree night weather, sleeping with just tshirt night shirt and thin leggings. So comfortable. A lot of tents were collapsed and flooded. This tent is the rainstorm champ.
customer_reviews.author: KisGG

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! WAY better then a regular tent
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely phenomenal tent! Weirdest thing about it, this is my first canvas tent, it will not free stand, it has to be anchored down. To practice with it I tried to set it up in my garage...on cement. Didn't work! The design requires it to be staked into the ground to even stand up. I just think that should be told about it. It's a wonderful tent, feels so nice that it truly feels like you're walking into another sealed off room...like a mini house or something. It holds heat well, is made of very nice material, and the floor is nice and thick. I love it l! Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Muenter

customer_reviews.title: High quality tent
customer_reviews.text: At the time of this review I only have used it once. I have been camping all my life using many different twnts. This tent really seems to be a quality item. Everything about it is heavy duty. The stakes and poles are way more serious than anything else I've used. It is not a backpacking tent it's nearly 80 pounds. Setup is super easy. The tent is nice and rigid standing up to wind and rain. I like the front awning. It's super tall with dual doors. I have a feeling I won't need a new tent for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Watch for damaged floor!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent November 25, 2019 in preparation for the upcoming camping season. I chose it because it had such good reviews. However, the tent has 2 small tears in the floor, which I did not discover until I decided to it put it up today, March 28 2020, to familiarize myself with the set up and take down process. Yes, I should have unpacked the tent and inspected it immediately upon arrival, but I trusted that all was right. Other than the tears, the tent seems very well made. I don’t take time to write reviews, but I am very disappointed that I was sold an expensive tent that was clearly damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent, we used it this past summer. Very easy to set up and take down. Very sturdy and well designed. We had plenty of room for 4 people, could easily fit 5, 8 would be very tight, there would be no room for bags, clothes, etc. It rained one night pretty good and no leaks noted at all. It is heavy, but really wasn't an issue for us. I would definitely recommend this tent to anyone who wants a high quality tent that won't leak and will last for many years, we are hoping this will be the last tent that we will ever have to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: InspectorMAC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Good Material
customer_reviews.text: Tall and great material. I really suggest at least two people to set it up because you need to hold the top up while putting in the side poles. You really need to stake the tent in the ground because only the two side poles keep it up. Went camping and wasn't bothered by the strong winds and rain. It was during winter and we put a heater in it. It warmed up in minutes and stayed warm. It also has a front and back entrance.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy Lobos

customer_reviews.title: Truly best tent...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS TENT! I got the 10x14 and is truly water proof. I was worried bout wind at first but after 40 mph gusts, no more worries. Until larger gusts lol.
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent. I have used several canvas tents and none are as easy to put up as this one. It's heavy but not too heavy for truck,ATV or mule pack. I set it up in my back yard the moment it came in. It took me about 25min. Lesson learned.... Make sure the black poles are all the way in. Unzip the door to let air in so you don't have to fight the vacuum during setup. I like to use imitation wool blankets as a rug to keep the tent floor clean and safe from equipment. This tent is the perfect size for a queen size mattress or 4 cots.
customer_reviews.author: jonny

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this last year. I used it a few times over the summer and was not disappointed. The floor of the tent is fantastic. Well Built. A wind storm came through our camp destroying 3 canopies and literally lifting my brothers family tent (a 8 man dome tent) off the ground and tumbling it away. It was nice to be able to go help others without any worries about my tent.
customer_reviews.author: Fred C

customer_reviews.title: Home On The Range
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Quality throughout. Many videos to set it up on YouTube. Worth the investment. Needed tent to withstand high winds; this one has stood up to 50 mph winds (see Customer reviews). Spacious airy. Will be my home 24/7 in the desert under blistering direct sun (canvas won't deteriorate like nylon/polyester tents in a few months). Looking forward to years of camping in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: TOP OF THE LINE!!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this and took it to the "White Mountains". This is the perfect tent and easy to put up. Someone on youtube recommended getting a "painters pole" to use with it - Great advice!! Someone else on youtube recommended a sheet of "painters plastic" to put in the bottom of the tent to keep things clean - also perfect advice since it rained almost everyday. This is definitely the best tent on the market and it can withhold serious rain and wind as tested and tried deep on the reservation in northern Arizona. The best thing was, the tent looks incredible when assembled. TOP OF THE LINE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Best all season tent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Rugged sturdy canvas, with some hefty weight. Definitely a 2 person setup, 3rd would be ideal. Provides ample walk around upright room. The shelving provides good storage. The hammock like shelving that goes across the width of the tent could use caribeaners instead of plastic snaps, doesn't hold much in the way of way, and if you run into it at night anything you put up there rains down on you. If you looking to set up camp for a few days definitely a tent worth getting. If you like changing camp sites or being mobile, probably not the tent for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Peterson

customer_reviews.title: The best tent available
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for deer camp and it beats the nylon tents by a mile. Our first use it rained for two days straight and I not talking about a gentle rain but down pouring rain. The tent held up very well and kept us dry. Took the family on a weekend camping trip and it performed flawlessly. The tent can be set up by one person in about a minuet and take down and storage is easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Garner

customer_reviews.title: Held up in nasty weather!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Kodiak Canvas tent I own. I ordered this one as I had a group of four and needed more room. Just like the four person version this tent is easy to set up. What was most impressive is that we experienced a big winter storm with two inches of ice accumulated. Other tents collapsed but the Kodiak Canvas held up to the nasty weather. Even with all the additional weight it held strong and was warm with the use of a small heater. The only drawback was the front awning collected ice and had we had to shed it off it’s low point.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Davis Jones

customer_reviews.title: This tent is durable and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this tent is far above the cheaper ones. It is very well made and with the storage pockets and hangers has comfort added. It is well worth the money. We had a ran storm come through with high winds (30 mpn) and it stayed in place with no leaks. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Burning Man
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect size for our lovely desert apartment in the Black Rock Desert. Keeps out the dust and had plenty of room to sleep and spend time in the tent when the winds picked up. Perfect for a queen mattress with room for shelves and living space. Would not recommend going any smaller (this was an upgrade from the 9x8 I bought last year that was way too small for 2).
customer_reviews.author: Emily S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent! Set up with two people was quick, easy take down as well. Stayed warm all night and wasn’t loud during the wind storm that came through. Comfortably slept 4 people on one king and one queen air mattress, with enough room for everybody’s bags. Cleans easily, stays dry. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: it stayed up sturdy and while the outside got soaked
customer_reviews.text: Have only had once chance to use it, but so far it's held up perfectly. Took it out in November to Fresno, were we had a rainstorm throughout the weekend. Just as described, it stayed up sturdy and while the outside got soaked, we stayed dry. The tent is HUGE - we fit our queen cot in there and all our bags/cooler, and had a ridiculous amount of space leftover. In the morning we could touch the inside of the tent and see the rain/condensation, but only if we smacked it did anything drip off. Looking forward to using this more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smallish tent with steep walls (hate those ones that tap your head, especially in rain). I wanted the best construction and an affordable price. I wanted to be general enough in design to handle deserts, mountains, east and west, rain or dry, cold or hot. It is just about perfect for this. The price is that it is heavy, so won't be going on foot into back country (nor will I anymore, come to think of it). Anyhow, I love it. Be warned, though, that some people may want the larger versions, if they need tons of space. This is for 3 people and our gear, or 4 people and not much else.
customer_reviews.author: T. Brown

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing tents, absolutely worth the money and weight if ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm upgrading to this for Burning Man after my camp mates all showed me theirs. These are amazing tents, absolutely worth the money and weight if you can swing it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Banks

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to set up and take down and very spacious ...
customer_reviews.text: If you've never been in a substantially constructed tent, you are in for a treat. We set this thing up in our yard and left it up for about 5 weeks. Aside from completely killing the grass underneath it, it withstood strong summer storms and never waivered or leaked. It is easy to set up and take down and very spacious inside. It cost a bit more than a typical tent and is heavy, but if you want space and durability at your campsite and can wrangle the weight (this is not a backpacking tent by any means), this is a fantastic tent. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Appalachian Techie

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Super heavy duty and extremely durable!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome and will stand up to anything you can throw at it. We have hunted elk in it for many few years. Last year we got caught in a huge snow storm with over a foot of snow and it performed flawlessly...we just knocked the snow off of the roof and it stayed nice and insulated! I love the extra doors that don't come with the springbar tent. Keep in mind though, this tent is heavy...just like it's springbar counterpart.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Man

customer_reviews.title: Very well made. Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty tent that is well made. We had 2 thunderstorms hit while camping one had 50 mph winds and one dumped 2.3 inches of rain. No leaks and the tent withstood the winds. We were very impressed and vappy with the tent. Not a tent for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research and finally decided to go with this tent. It's heavy but easy to put up solo. I spent 4 nights in it with plenty of heavy rain and I stayed 100% dry. I really like the vestibule that allows the doors to open (leaving the screens closed). For scale, the REI tent in my picture is a 6 person tent my buddy brought.
customer_reviews.author: min

customer_reviews.title: This is the most amazing tent. Yes
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing tent. Yes, it's heavy, excellent quality. I set it up by myself (I'm 62, female) when it arrived. Very easy! I've only been able to camp once with it this year. Looking forward to next summer when I plan on taking a couple of months to wander.
customer_reviews.author: CCSparkle

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I like it it's quieter than nylon it's big enough for my OCD overpacking I use a 90x36 cot I kinda wish I'd bought the 10x10, but this is a great tent BTW, I'm 70yrs old, been camping since the '50's
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: We will NEVER purchase another tent that isn’t a Kodiak!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the Kodiak Canvas Flex-now deluxe for a three week excursion through Northeastern US with the family. We camped in PA, NY, and ME in various conditions including heat, cold, wind and thunderstorms. Not a drop of water in the tent and it held up wonderfully to severe wind gusts. Our family of four had plenty of room for our two cots and two air mattresses. Setup and breakdown were a cinch with the kids learning how to help after the first campsite. Our adventure could not have been as enjoyable without our Kodiak!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Stayed dry. Spacious. Highly functional tent. The gear loft, and hanging organizers that came with it were great. Seems durable. Only complaint is that I couldn’t stake it flat, so there were some waves in it, and it made opening the door annoying, as it would get stuck in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Nowaczyk

customer_reviews.title: Easily fits 2 cots with room to spare
customer_reviews.text: EASY TO SET UP AND AWESOME!! I bought this for my son and I. Went from using a standard 4 person dome tent to this. The size is perfect for 2 cots and room in the middle to walk and stand. Easily set it up but myself. Didn't want to buy the 6 person because I didn't need the extra room and I usually camp off a boat in the woods so didn't need any extra weight. Plus it's a little easier to find a spot to put this tent in the woods than anything bigger. Don't hesitate, buy this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Scout Leaders! (Unless you are backpacking!)
customer_reviews.text: As someone who camps at least once a month, this tent has been a lifesaver! I was tired of broken poles and tents that leak. I have had my Kodiak for over a year, and it has gotten me through the toughest rainy weather! The other scout leaders brag about their pop-ups, but they have all had to replace them multiple times. My Kodiak just keeps on going! Can't take it backpacking, but hey, that's what hammocks are for! PROS: Waterproof, roomy, easy to set up, durable, good ventilation CONS: Heavy, not freestanding, must dry completely before storing
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Irene

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty tent designed to withstand the elements. Setup and tear down are surprising easily, even for one person. Good quality, features, and value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in NC

customer_reviews.title: Never been more happy with a tent
customer_reviews.text: Never been more happy with a tent, and not a regrettable big purchase at all. My family of three outgrew our two person backpacking tent as my kid turned three, and we lukily found this awesome tent to achieve a dramatic upgrade. High quality, comfortable, sooo much room, easy to put up, waterproof - also heavy, and bulky - it's kind of a complicated relationship. But... I do love it for family car camping or longer term trips where you want a cabin feel to your tent and a place that is immune to some of the most annoying elements.
customer_reviews.author: Johnhenry555

customer_reviews.title: Seems very sturdy. Heavy duty floor
customer_reviews.text: I set this baby up in my back yard right after i got it mainly to let it air out. I was impressed by the quality. Seems very sturdy. Heavy duty floor. You will never go backpacking with it. It is heavy but comes with a nice duffle bag. I love that it is tall so you can get dressed while standing up. My friend is a hunter and highly recommended this tent. He said he's been through some rough weather and never had to treat the canvas with anything. I will try it out for myself next weekend...can't wait!!
customer_reviews.author: Randy R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tent
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews online and watched youtube videos. I was impressed so I bit the bullet and bought this tent. Very well made and heavy duty tent. We camped in 13 degree weather and stayed warm with a heater. It's pricey but worth every penny. We will def get a lot of use out of this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Haven't camped in it yet, but I set it up, and it looks and feels amazing. I plan to get a lot of comfortable use out of it. Instructions are kind of confusing first set up, suggest just googling it for much faster set up
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent! Durable, roomy, wind resistant, and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: We used this tent for several car camping trips a year for 5 years. We love it. However there are a couple issues inherent in this type of tent. Its very bulky and heavy. And it is moderately difficult to set up because you need 15 well placed heavy duty stakes. The tent frame is not self supporting like most tents. The stakes are essential to holding it up. So we did not use it when moving camp every night (we used a little backpacking tent) but when we stayed put for several days we pitched this guy with pride......
customer_reviews.author: BBlackie

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: We took this tent on a 3 month overlanding trip. It endured all kinds of severe weather, torrential rain storms, high winds, sand storms, hot and freezing temperatures. The design is innovative yet simple. This is one tough tent. We even ended up one morning surrounded by an inch of sea water when the tide came in. when we were in Baja and it still remained dry inside. I might just buy the bigger one for our next trip.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Best Tent I ever owned....
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my previous camping.... Its well made both fabric and structure pieces.... I love it... only concern is that its pretty heavy for some.... but my wife and I managed it and felt like we were in luxury castle in the mountains of California. I plan to go on several winter camping with it and my propane heater..... My only concern is that I have not had it on wet condition.... And its instruction recommends that it needs to be dried before storing it..... I can easily do that in California because its pretty dry but how would you do that if you are from Seattle or Virginia...where it rains regularly... Hmmmm Anyhow its worth the investment....
customer_reviews.author: Sangrok Koo

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Winter camping in lots of rain and wind. Outstanding product. Made very well. Easy to put up. Nice thick floor for a tent. Material is awesome. Would buy another one , if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Great family tent!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this tent! I researched four season tents because our family wanted to get serious about camping in New Mexico's rough wilderness. I've taken it hunting in December with 16 degree nights (and a heater) and we've been out several times this summer. It has been great! Easy for me to setup and take down by myself. Our family of six sleep very comfortably. I'll be buying this tent again, after some great uses from our current setup.
customer_reviews.author: Lori C. Fair

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent
customer_reviews.text: Really have nothing bad to say all pros had the tent now for 3 years it's freaking awesome a little on the heavy side but you know that before you buy have had in some bad storms it it did just fine hands down my favorite tent and I have five different ones
customer_reviews.author: Todd Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Best Tent ever
customer_reviews.text: Best Tent ever... I have two of them. Went through a serious FL fall storm and every other tent at the site was down and flooded. I woke up and everyone was amazed that not only the tent was still standing but also BONE dry. Only wish the new version with the giant windows was out when I bought these two. They do get hot in the summer and air doesn't circulate through them very well in the muggy FL forests.
customer_reviews.author: Native Texan

customer_reviews.title: Well built tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing, built very well. Perfect for 2 or 3 people with hunting gear and cots. I did my homework for about 2 months trying to pick a cold weather canvas tent and this is the right choice. There's really no cons. Easy to fold up into the bag has a separate bag for the poles. The pole bag is double layered at the bottom. Pockets everywhere, 2 little vents for a propane heater on the ends. Very thick bottom. Wish i could fig out how to upload pics
customer_reviews.author: blake g.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Used the tent once dried it out. Put it back in the bag it came in went to set it up again and had holes in the roof. No way to contact the seller for a return not impressed with the quality of this product
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Young

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Product just as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Came in less time than originally listed. Great price! Product just as I thought. The set up is amazingly quick. First time set up with my 8 year old son helping was about 10 minutes and that was with reading the instructions. Granted we didn't fully stake it down, but that wouldnt take much longer. Great size and we stayed in the tent for at least 30 minutes in the middle of the day and it didn't get hot at all. We can't wait to try it out at Burning Man.
customer_reviews.author: ladydiva

customer_reviews.title: A really nice little tent and quick to erect
customer_reviews.text: A really nice little tent and quick to erect. A great tent for car camping. I added a fly for camping in the desert. Keeps it a tad cooler.
customer_reviews.author: James McCandless, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent. Best we've owned
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tent. Ventilation is good but wish we'd went with the vx model. Setup is very easy. Takes longer to stake than anything. It is heavy but it's a canvas tent. We expected that. Think we are done with cheaper nylon tents. We will be buying the 4 person for smaller areas and dispersed camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bordner

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a tent that will last a long time, take a look at a Kodiak Flex Bow Canvas Tent.
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to beat quality, and the Kodiak Canvas Flex-Bow is quality. When I received the tent I immediately set it up in the back yard for practice. What followed was 3 days of rain and wind. Then the temperature dropped to 49 degrees. I dug out our small electric heater and in 20 minutes the tent interior was 70 degrees, and dry. My grandson could not believe the stand up room, and he is just over 6 foot tall. I would suggest the 10x14 size, especially after spending 5 days in the back yard on the initial set up, there was plenty of room to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Buy that even the bride bragged on it.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with quality and ease of setup. Tested it out with wife and faithful wonder dog this past weekend at one of our ol time favorite campgrounds; Hunting Island, SC. All of us enjoyed it immensely. Simple and efficient design with roof height idea for us 60 plus year old seasoned citizens who treasure the outdoors. Wish we had gone this route years ago rather than purchasing a pop-up camper that was a constant maintenance issue. Already have the next month's camping trip reserved and anxious to go...
customer_reviews.author: George H. Mitchler

customer_reviews.title: Love at last!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this tent. It is so easy to erect, roomy and comfortable to stay in, and having an attached canopy is so convenient! With my old tent I had to bring a separate canopy in order to protect the entrance of the tent. The height of this tent meant I could stand fully erect with plenty of room to spare. Everything is just so well thought out with this tent from the 4 entry doors to the height to the canopy. I can't say enough good things about this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Received in a timely manner. Easy to set up after watching u-tube videos. Only problem conceivable is that, with sloped sides, you don't actually have the amount of room I was expecting. Seems to be constructed solidly. I'm spending 4 to 5 nights a week in it as a campground host and, aside from being slightly smaller than anticipated, it's a great tent.
customer_reviews.author: topo'therockies

customer_reviews.title: Roomy & High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Really glad with this purchase. It was everything I expected. The tent is quite large at 10'x14' which can make it challenging when finding a campsite with tent pads that are standard 12'x12' only. That's really the only drawback I've found. It is heavy but at least comes in two bags - one for the tent and another for the poles and stakes.
customer_reviews.author: David Drouin

customer_reviews.title: Best tent ever?
customer_reviews.text: Worth every cent, I'm sure it will last many years.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Best tent ever
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a awesome tent. And easy to put up. This is it. One person can put this up and take it down. Extremely happy with the quality. Won’t need to buy another tent for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tabby white

customer_reviews.title: Best tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: This tent is well worth the money, I camp in the Rocky Mtns the first time out it rained, snowed, gropled, The wind blew, and this tent stayed warm and dry, I have a propane heater in it for cold weather and look forward to snow camping as this is a true 4 season tent, It sets up well with only one person, Far superior to a nylon tent, Look forward to many years of use, Don't hesitate go ahead and buy it you wont be sorry
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best tent ever
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best tent I have ever owned. It can handle very strong beach winds. It was tested in a terrible rain/wind storm the day I took it out of the box when we camped on the beach and it held up great!
customer_reviews.author: Toni Pesce

customer_reviews.title: Pricy but well worth it! The second time we ...
customer_reviews.text: Pricy but well worth it! The second time we used the tent it POURED in the high Sierras for 2 days straight and everything stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew S. Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Best tent I have owned so far
customer_reviews.text: Best tent I have owned so far. Used it in the mountains of Pennsylvania during a rain storm and not a single leak. Has lots of room for my family of five, and is easy to set up. Would recommend for anyone who car camps or does overlanding but doesn't want a rooftop tent.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lathrop

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set up and break down
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up and break down. We got to camp after dark and had to set it up for the first time in the dark... no issues at all, took about 10 min. Fit the 6 of us comfortably with plenty of extra space. We camped through a thunderstorm with no problems (thank goodness). I'm planning to buy a smaller version. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow zebra

customer_reviews.title: This tent is like a tiny house in a bag
customer_reviews.text: This tent is like a tiny house in a bag. Its heavy, but the space and the luxury is amazing. This is the best tent I have ever own and can see it lasting a lift time.
customer_reviews.author: Marcin

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TENT
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I spent a week in this tent near Lake Placid, NY last week. I set tent up and took down by myself, super easy. We had a couple days of rain, never once got wet inside of tent.....a suggestion here....put awnings on both side of tent to help with air flow in downpours. During rain could only open non awning side a couple inches or else rain came in. Other than that would highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: ... this for a homeless friend and it is the best tent! While other tents cannot stand the strong ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a homeless friend and it is the best tent! While other tents cannot stand the strong winds we receive in the southwest, the Kodiak Canvas Flex-Bow can! It's still standing strong through everyday use for 5 months which included below freezing temperatures and the windy season. 100 degree temperatures are coming up as well as the monsoon season and we are confident this tent will continue to stand and protect.
customer_reviews.author: Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Great easy to setup tent. Love how you can walk around in it. Feels like it
customer_reviews.author: Shep

customer_reviews.title: It was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I practically took this tent camping right out of the box. It was very easy to set up. The poles are steel which makes for a very sturdy structure. This tent is 90 percent waterproof. There were a few drips from the roof and a small leak on one of the seams next to our air bed. We had a few good down pours on one day. So only to get a few leaks and not waterproof the tent is pretty good. I would recommend using their recommended waterproofing spray before your first outing with the tent. I would absolutely recommend this tent to anyone looking for a canvas tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... have an orgy inside this thing and still be comfortable. No stepping on hearts anymore
customer_reviews.text: Big enough to have an orgy inside this thing and still be comfortable. No stepping on hearts anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product line
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Once arrived easy to setup and sturdy. Used 4 times since purchase have remained dry in rain storms. Love it..
customer_reviews.author: Pam R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy but it means it won't get destroyed in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL MCQUIVEY

customer_reviews.title: Quality shows
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put up. Much easier than my previous Coleman 8 man insta tent. I love it so far
customer_reviews.author: robert k bivens

customer_reviews.title: Dry , easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome dry roomey tent. Camped all over Florida last winter,not a drop of water inside. Great set up for 1. 65 year old man in pretty good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up definitely rainproof was out for a week rain three days didn’t leak
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Drove across the country with this tent. Had no problems even on the rainy northwest coast.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Smith

customer_reviews.title: You get more than you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: This canvas tent is worth every penny. My wife and I had our hearts set on a wall tent but the price is a bit high on them so we decided to go with this Kodiak canvas tent and we are very very happy with the quality and comfort. Our tent has survived 62 mile per hour wind gusts, 2 inch down pour rains, and still stood like nothing happened. This flex bow technology is the way to go. Also, this Kodiak tent can be set up by on person.......that grew up in the country.
customer_reviews.author: JD 770

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, and heavy, durable, but still heavy
customer_reviews.text: This thing has weathered some pretty serious conditions and still works great. It will last me a long time and is well worth the money. Though it is really heavy and bulky. Not good if you are trying to pack stuff in a limited space or have to fly anywhere with it. The pegs are good quality and long enough to anchor it into any terrain. The pegs for the flap/canopy and guyline are not very good though.
customer_reviews.author: N. Domino

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. We drenched it with the water hose and there were no leaks. It’s very roomy inside. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: carla

customer_reviews.title: Makes camping fun again.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is very well constructed, sets up easily, and is spacious and comfortable. A great shelter in any weather. If you're going to be in direct sunlight, be sure to leave the windows unzipped or it will get pretty hot in there. The two corner vents aren't enough by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: The tent is wonderful! I am over 50 and I can set ...
customer_reviews.text: The tent is wonderful! I am over 50 and I can set it up by myself in 30 minutes, including staking! Once you divide the canvas from the poles it makes each about 40 lbs which I can carry by myself. The mesh shelf and "stuff holders" that can be clipped onto the inside take away the need for table space. For 2 people the tent can be set up with one end for sleeping and the other for sitting in if the weather is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than a camp trailor
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. I put a colman queen size inflatable bed , a rug and a chair. This is so much better than a trailor in so many ways
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Wind proof!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! Easy to set up and took 50+ mph winds like a champ! Completely waterproof right out of the box, not a drip through 1.5 inch downpour. Will love to camp in this tent for many years to come. Thanks Kodiak for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Best tent ever
customer_reviews.text: Best tent ever. It's a challenge for a 5'5 130lb me to put it up, and I can do it!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Lora

customer_reviews.title: Great canvas tent
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tent up since January 1 2020 plenty of rain and freezing weather. I live in it while my house is being remodeled. No problems 😊 I can say I have gotten my money worth and then some. Very happy with this ⛺
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Tent
customer_reviews.text: Best decision I ever made. Tip: Use a 10X12 Blue tarp as a footprint and get a little broom. You will not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher McCann

customer_reviews.title: So roomy for our family!
customer_reviews.text: We took our new tent out for our first camping trip beyond the backyard, and we were very comfortable. It was easy to assemble. I loved how bright it was inside during the daytime hours, making it easy to find things. I was not afraid of rain, almost looking forward to snuggling with the kiddos and passing time together. It did not rain this trip, so I cannot comment on how waterproof/leakproof it is.
customer_reviews.author: Shoe8297

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy in wind
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our son who camps in the windy desert. He says it's super easy to put up by himself and it's roomy for 2 adults 2 kids.. Very sturdy, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Janig

customer_reviews.title: WE LOVE OUR KODIAK CANVAS TENT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second summer with this tent. Just took a short 1 night trip with a friend, my son and myself, plus our two dogs. We all fit comfortably. My friend was amazed at the quality of the tent and the ease in which it is put up. I am an old school guy, so this is perfect for us. Reminds me of my father's tent when I was a kid. Great quality, heavy duty, should last for years provided it is maintained properly.
customer_reviews.author: SC Family

product_meta.title: Kodiak Canvas Flex-Bow Canvas Tent Deluxe
product_meta.description:
Whether you’re headed to the campground with your family, or elk camp with your hunting buddies, this rugged, all-season tent is well suited for the occasion. Made with premium grade, Hydra-Shield, 100% cotton duck canvas. The tight weave and silicone finish make the canvas watertight yet breathable, minimizing condensation and mugginess. Go ahead and touch the inside walls during a downpour—this canvas will not wick water. The Flex-Bow frame has tempered, spring steel rods that keep the tent taut, and robust 1-inch steel tube poles that will hold up to fierce winds. The floor material is a puncture resistant, 13.5 oz vinyl with welded seams, that keeps water out. Easy, one-person setup takes only a few minutes after you have it staked out. The steep walls and 6’1” high ceiling provide a roomy interior with stand-up, walk-around comfort. Large front and back doors with top rated #10 YKK zippers give convenient access. Four windows, and two vents allow ample air flow. Windows and vents have no-see-um screen mesh, keeping out the smallest bugs. A customizable gear organizer system offers plenty of places to stow gear. A large awning provides shade and a covered entry. Sturdy storage bags and hefty 12-inch steel stakes are included.

AMAZON.COM
Whether you're heading to the campground with the family or the elk camp with your hunting buddies, the rugged, all-season Kodiak Canvas Flex-Bow six-person tent is well suited to the occasion. The Flex-Bow tent is made of a superior, marine-grade, 100-percent cotton duck Hydra-Shield canvas. The custom-woven, treated canvas is ideal for tents, as the double-fill design is strong and durable, while the silicone, dry-finish treatment is watertight, breathable, and durable. As a result, campers will stay comfortable and dry even in a downpour. Unlike synthetic fabrics or canvas with a paraffin- or oil-based treatment, Kodiak's canvas allows water vapor to escape, minimizing condensation, humidity, and mugginess. Plus, you'll rarely--if ever--have to retreat Kodiak canvas. 

 The Flex-Bow frame is every bit as strong, with 1-inch galvanized steel tubing and 3/8-inch Flex-Bow spring steel rods keeping the tent taut at all times. To further improve ventilation, the tent includes two funnel-flow vents that circulate air and assist with temperature management. And campers won't feel claustrophobic thanks to the tent's spacious 6-foot 6-inch ceiling height, two large D-shaped doors (front and back), and four large windows, all covered with no-see-um mesh. Other details include a 16-ounce, polyester-reinforced vinyl floor; a large 72-by-78-inch awning; a customizable gear loft and organizer pockets; and a handy strap-and-cinch storage bag. The Flex-Bow, which sets up easily with one person, is designed for year-round use, but isn't suitable for extreme winter mountaineering or heavy snow accumulations. 

 



The Flex-Bow's spacious footprint sleeps up to 6 people. Specifications
 * Capacity: 6 people 
 * Ceiling material: 10-ounce Hydra-Shield canvas 
 * Wall material: 8.5-ounce Hydra-Shield canvas 
 * Floor material: 16-ounce polyester-reinforced vinyl with welded seams 
 * Frame: 1-inch galvanized steel tubing 
 * Rods: 3/8-inch solid spring steel Flex-Bow rods 
 * Tent dimensions: 10 by 10 feet 
 * Ceiling height: 6 feet 6 inches 
 * Pack weight: 68 pounds (includes stakes weighing 6.5 pounds total) 
 * Pack size: 30 by 13 inches, with pole bundle measuring 50 inches long and 5.5 inches in diameter 
 * Warranty: Limited lifetime warranty 

 About Kodiak Canvas
Born in the ruggedness of the Rockies, Kodiak Canvas has quickly earned a reputation for making tough, long-lasting tents ideal for almost any camping scenario. Each tent is made of top-of-the-line materials and components, helping Kodiak tents far outlive cheaper-made tents. The company's tents feature Hydra-Shield canvas construction, a tough, long-lasting material that minimizes mugginess and holds up to strong winds, driving rain, and even moderate snowfalls.
feature_bullets: Made with Hydra-Shield, 100% cotton duck canvas that is durable, watertight and breathable
Spacious 6'6" ceiling height provides walk-around comfort
Two large D-shaped doors (front and back) with #10 YKK zippers
Four large windows with no-see-um mesh
Flex-Bow Frame: Exceptionally sturdy. Keeps tent taut. Quick and easy, one-person, setup
Dimensions: 10 ft W x 10 ft D x 6'6" H
Large (72 x 78 inches) awning provides covered entry and shade.
Pack Weight: 68 lbs. (includes 6.5 lbs in stakes).
All-season: Use year-round, but not designed for extreme winter mountaineering or heavy snow accumulations.
Made with Hydra-Shield, 100% cotton duck canvas that is durable, watertight and breathable
Spacious 6'6" ceiling height provides walk-around comfort. Weight:73.00 LBS
Two large D-shaped doors (front and back) with #10 YKK zippers
Four large windows with no-see-um mesh
Two funnel-flow vents help improve air flow and temperature management
